body: @atdiar / @perses SemVer, when used, allows for a package to have breaking changes. We do not need to reinvent any wheels and we do not need to force into a illusion that all APIs will forever be correct and not change (and just have a look at popular packages which all at some point had breaking changes for which users were notified via a PR / README change instead of bumping a major version of the said package).
